May 8 at 9:59 AM ¬∑

Calling All Students in Grades 1-5!

The outbreak of COVID-19 has limited us all. Teachers from all over the Commonwealth are faced with creating new ways to teach their students. This is very challenging for everyone. This is why the Massachusetts State Police Recruitment Unit has implemented a voluntary homework assignment for any school in the commonwealth, grades 1-5. A student can send a picture of themselves demonstrating how they are following good sanitizing and distancing practices. (I.E., Standing apart, washing their hands, wearing a mask) This is a great way to learn and have fun at the same time. Students are encouraged to seek assistance from their parents or legal guardian. Stress bears will be given out while supplies last.

All pictures can be sent via email to the following, and please include your name and mailing address if you'd like one of our stress bears, while supplies last. Msp.recruitment@pol.state.ma.us

shared_text:
New England Aquarium
April 9 at 11:00 AM ¬∑

Our harbor seal Amelia gets her nails trimmed as part of our harbor seal training! Keeping our harbor seals' nails trimmed helps them to climb on the rocks, so it is an important part of their training! #VirtualVisit #AquariumFromHome
.
.
You may notice something unique about Amelia. She only has one eye! Amelia had long term discomfort in her left eye that our veterinarians attempted to correct with medication and surgery. Despite best efforts, it became evident that the only way to relieve her discomfort, was to remove her eye. Amelia sees very well out of her right eye and also uses her whiskers to pick up on vibrations in the water to provide more information about her surroundings, as do all Atlantic harbor seals. In order to take excellent care of Amelia's health before her surgery, she was trained to allow us to give her eye drops when necessary. Staff also focus on a variety of other equally important husbandry behaviors including blood samples, weighing our animals, brushing the seals' teeth and even clipping their nails like you can see in this video!

February 12 at 11:44 AM ¬∑

On February 28, 2020, the Foxborough Police Department, in conjunction with Safe Kids Worldwide and MA Child Passenger Safety Program, funded by the Executive Office of Public Safety and Security, will be hosting a car seat checkup.

Location: 8 Chestnut Street, Foxborough, MA 02035
Time: 1pm- 3pm by appointment only

Keeping kids safe in the car is one of our most important jobs as parents and caregivers.

‚Ä¢ Car crashes are one of the leading causes of death and injury for kids. Proper use of car seats helps keep children safer in the event of a crash.
‚Ä¢ Car seats reduce the risk of injury by over 71% and reduce the risk of death by 28% in comparison to children restrained by seat belts only.
‚Ä¢ Booster seats reduce the risk of non-fatal injuries in a crash by 45% among four-to-eight year olds.

To set up an appointment for February 28, 2020 please send an email to wmonterroso@foxboroughpolice.com
